STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 27, 2024
Jeremy Mulvany
Eaton County Youth Home Facility
822 Courthouse Drive
Charlotte, MI 48813-1069
Re: License #: CO230201104
Renewal Inspection
Dear Jeremy Mulvany:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 02/14/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The start date of the updated service plan is to immediately follow the end date of the
initial service plan. For example, Eaton County Youth Home does the following:
Youth A is admitted 09/23/2023. Youth A’s initial service plan has a start date of
09/23/2023 and ends 10/20/2023. Youth A’s updated service plan has a start date of

10/23/2023 and an end date of 01/19/2024. In this example, the initial service plan is
completed within 30 days of admission and the updated service plan is completed
within 90 days after the completion of the initial service plan. 10/21/2023 and
10/22/2023 information is included in the updated service plan, but the dates are not
identified in the reporting dates. Eaton County Youth Home is to change this practice.
Using the dates from the example, initial service plan would be 09/23/2023 to
10/20/2023 and the updated service plan would be 10/21/2023 to 01/19/2024. This
captures all service dates.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
None at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
Review of Eaton County budget report shows Eaton County Youth Facility – Community
Based Treatment has adequate funding.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not applicable.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One administrator and two staff were interviewed during this inspection. Chief
administrator stated the expansion of Eaton County Youth Home Facility is targeted for
completion in 09/2024. Staff spoke positively about working at Eaton County Youth
Home, were knowledgeable about policy and procedures, and did not express concerns.
One staff suggested training include topics on self-care.

Two youths were interviewed during this inspection. Both youths stated feeling safe at
the facility and did not express concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Eaton County Youth Home Facility walk through completed on 02/14/2024 found the
agency neat and orderly. Issues were not noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
02/26/2024
___________________________________
Vivian D Malleck Date
